name: Akureyri Botanical Garden
description: These are one of the world's northernmost botanical gardens, located just 50 kilometers (31 miles) south of the Arctic Circle. Established in 1957 within a city park that originated in 1912, the gardens now span 3.6 hectares. They host over 7,000 plant species, serving as a peaceful oasis for locals and visitors, and a site for scientific research.

opening_hours.gates/toilets: Summer: 08:00 - 22:00. Winter: Gates open, toilets closed.
